Package com.atakmap.map.layer.feature

Interface FeatureDataStore

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Disposable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataSourceFeatureDataStore
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataSourceFeatureDataStore, AbstractFeatureDataStore, AbstractFeatureDataStore2, AbstractReadOnlyFeatureDataStore, FeatureDatabase, FeatureSetDatabase, GeoPackageFeatureDataStore, PersistentDataSourceFeatureDataStore2, RuntimeDataSourceFeatureDataStore, WFSFeatureDataStore3
    @Deprecated
@DeprecatedApi(since="5.3",
               forRemoval=true,
               removeAt="5.6")
public interface FeatureDataStore
extends Disposable
    Deprecated.
    use FeatureDataStore3
    A data store for feature data.

    Implementations are expected to be thread-safe. Multiple threads should be able to access an instance concurrently without producing undefined behavior.

      Callback interface providing notification when the content of the data store has changed.

      • getFeature

        Feature getFeature​(long fid)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the feature with the specified ID. The returned feature should be considered immutable; behavior is undefined if the feature is actively modified.
        Parameters:
        fid - The feature ID
        Returns:
        The feature with the specified ID or null if the data store does not contain such a feature.

      • queryFeatures

        FeatureCursor queryFeatures​(FeatureDataStore.FeatureQueryParameters params)
        Deprecated.
        Returns a cursor over all features satisfying the specified FeatureDataStore.FeatureQueryParameters. The returned features should be considered immutable; behavior is undefined if the features are actively modified.
        Parameters:
        params - The query parameters. If null all features are selected.
        Returns:
        A cursor over all features satisfying params.

      • queryFeaturesCount

        int queryFeaturesCount​(FeatureDataStore.FeatureQueryParameters params)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the number of features that satisfy the specified FeatureDataStore.FeatureQueryParameters.
        Parameters:
        params - The query parameters. If null all features are selected.
        Returns:
        The number of features satisfying params.

      • getModificationFlags

        int getModificationFlags()
        Deprecated.
        Returns the bit-wise OR of modification flags for the data store. Methods that modify the data store may only be successfully invoked if the associated bit flag is present.
        Returns:
        The modification flags for the data store.

      • beginBulkModification

        void beginBulkModification()
        Deprecated.
        Notifies the data store that a bulk modification will be occurring. The data store may opt not to commit or notify on content changed until the bulk modification is complete. An invocation of this method should always be paired with an invocation of endBulkModification(boolean) once the bulk modification is completed, successfully or otherwise.

        Nested bulk modifications are considered undefined; the user should always check isInBulkModification() before invoking this method.

        Unless otherwise specified by the implementation, it should be assumed that modifications to the data store during a bulk modification may only be made on the thread that began the bulk modification.

        See Also:
        MODIFY_BULK_MODIFICATIONS, getModificationFlags(), endBulkModification(boolean), isInBulkModification()

      • endBulkModification

        void endBulkModification​(boolean successful)
        Deprecated.
        Notifies the data store that the bulk modification is complete. If unsuccessful, the data store is expected to undo all modifications issued during the bulk modification.
        Parameters:
        successful - true if the bulk modification should be considered successful, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        MODIFY_BULK_MODIFICATIONS, getModificationFlags(), #beginBulkModification(boolean)

      • isInBulkModification

        boolean isInBulkModification()
        Deprecated.
        Checks to see if the data store is currently in a bulk modification.
        Returns:
        true if the data store is in a bulk modification, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        beginBulkModification()

      • insertFeatureSet

        FeatureSet insertFeatureSet​(java.lang.String provider,
                            java.lang.String type,
                            java.lang.String name,
                            double minResolution,
                            double maxResolution,
                            boolean returnRef)
        Deprecated.
        Inserts a new feature set into the data store.
        Parameters:
        provider - The provider that parsed/generated the features that will be associated with the feature set
        type - The type of the content
        name - The name of the feature set.
        minResolution - The minimum display resolution for the feature set. Double.MAX_VALUE should be used if the set's features have no minimum resolution threshold.
        maxResolution - The max display resolution for the feature set. A value of 0.0d should be used if the set's features have no minimum resolution threshold.
        returnRef - A flag indicating whether or not a reference to the newly inserted feature set should be returned. Returning the feature set may introduce unwanted overhead in the event that it is not going to be immediately used.
        Returns:
        If returnRef is true, returns the feature set that was newly inserted
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the modification operation is not supported for this data store
        See Also:
        MODIFY_FEATURESET_INSERT, getModificationFlags()

      • updateFeatureSet

        void updateFeatureSet​(long fsid,
                      java.lang.String name)
        Deprecated.
        Updates the feature set name.
        Parameters:
        fsid - The feature set ID
        name - The new name for the feature set
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the modification operation is not supported for this data store
        See Also:
        MODIFY_FEATURESET_NAME, MODIFY_FEATURESET_UPDATE, getModificationFlags()

      • updateFeatureSet

        void updateFeatureSet​(long fsid,
                      double minResolution,
                      double maxResolution)
        Deprecated.
        Updates the feature set display thresholds.
        Parameters:
        fsid - The feature set ID
        minResolution - The minimum display resolution for the feature set. Double.MAX_VALUE should be used if the set's features have no minimum resolution threshold.
        maxResolution - The max display resolution for the feature set. A value of 0.0d should be used if the set's features have no minimum resolution threshold.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the modification operation is not supported for this data store
        See Also:
        MODIFY_FEATURESET_DISPLAY_THRESHOLDS, MODIFY_FEATURESET_UPDATE, getModificationFlags()

        void updateFeatureSet​(long fsid,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      double minResolution,
                      double maxResolution)
        Deprecated.
        Updates the feature set name and display thresholds.
        Parameters:
        fsid - The feature set ID
        name - The new name for the feature set
        minResolution - The minimum display resolution for the feature set. Double.MAX_VALUE should be used if the set's features have no minimum resolution threshold.
        maxResolution - The max display resolution for the feature set. A value of 0.0d should be used if the set's features have no minimum resolution threshold.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the modification operation is not supported for this data store
        See Also:
        MODIFY_FEATURESET_NAME, MODIFY_FEATURESET_DISPLAY_THRESHOLDS, MODIFY_FEATURESET_UPDATE, getModificationFlags()

      • insertFeature

        Feature insertFeature​(long fsid,
                      java.lang.String name,
                      Geometry geom,
                      Style style,
                      AttributeSet attributes,
                      boolean returnRef)
        Deprecated.
        Inserts the specified feature.
        Parameters:
        fsid - The feature set ID to add the new feature to
        name - The feature's name
        geom - The feature's geometry
        style - The feature's style
        attributes - The feature's attributes
        returnRef - A flag indicating whether or not a reference to the newly inserted Feature should be returned. Returning the feature may introduce unwanted overhead in the event that it is not going to be immediately used.
        Returns:
        If returnRef is true, returns the Feature that was just inserted into the data store. The Feature should be considered immutable; external modifications to its properties will produced undefined results.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the modification operation is not supported for this data store
        See Also:
        MODIFY_FEATURESET_FEATURE_INSERT, getModificationFlags()

      • insertFeature

        Feature insertFeature​(long fsid,
                      FeatureDefinition def,
                      boolean returnRef)
        Deprecated.
        Inserts the specified feature from the definitoin.
        Parameters:
        fsid - The feature set ID to add the new feature to
        def - The feature's definition
        returnRef - A flag indicating whether or not a reference to the newly inserted Feature should be returned. Returning the feature may introduce unwanted overhead in the event that it is not going to be immediately used.
        Returns:
        If returnRef is true, returns the Feature that was just inserted into the data store. The Feature should be considered immutable; external modifications to its properties will produced undefined results.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - If the modification operation is not supported for this data store
        See Also:
        MODIFY_FEATURESET_FEATURE_INSERT, getModificationFlags()

      • getVisibilitySettingsFlags

        int getVisibilitySettingsFlags()
        Deprecated.
        Returns the visibility settings flags for the data store. These flags reflect what visibility settings are available over the feature sets and features.
        Returns:
        The visibility settings flags for the data store
        See Also:
        VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURE, VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURESET

      • setFeatureVisible

        void setFeatureVisible​(long fid,
                       boolean visible)
        Deprecated.
        Sets the specified feature's visibility. Invoking this method may result in an update to the parent feature set's visibility.
        Parameters:
        fid - The feature ID
        visible - true to set the feature visible, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if getVisibilitySettingsFlags() does not have the VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURE bit toggled.
        See Also:
        VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURE, getVisibilitySettingsFlags(), isFeatureSetVisible(long)

      • setFeaturesVisible

        void setFeaturesVisible​(FeatureDataStore.FeatureQueryParameters params,
                        boolean visible)
        Deprecated.
        Sets the visibility of the features that match the specified query parameters. Invoking this method may result in an update to the parent feature set's visibility.
        Parameters:
        params - The feature query parameters
        visible - true to set the feature visible, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if getVisibilitySettingsFlags() does not have the VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURE bit toggled.
        See Also:
        VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURE, getVisibilitySettingsFlags(), isFeatureSetVisible(long)

      • isFeatureVisible

        boolean isFeatureVisible​(long fid)
        Deprecated.
        Returns the specified feature's current visibility. If visibility settings are not supported, this method should always return true. If visibility is only supported at the feature set level, this method should return true if the parent feature set is visible.
        Parameters:
        fid - The feature ID
        Returns:
        true if the feature is visible, false otherwise.

      • setFeatureSetVisible

        void setFeatureSetVisible​(long setId,
                          boolean visible)
        Deprecated.
        Sets the specified feature set's visibility. Invoking this method will update the visibility state of all of the feature set's features to match the specified visibility state for the feature set.
        Parameters:
        fid - The feature set ID
        visible - true to set the feature set and all of its features visible, false to set the feature set and all of its features invisible.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if getVisibilitySettingsFlags() does not have the VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURESET bit toggled.
        See Also:
        VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURESET, getVisibilitySettingsFlags()

      • setFeatureSetsVisible

        void setFeatureSetsVisible​(FeatureDataStore.FeatureSetQueryParameters params,
                           boolean visible)
        Deprecated.
        Sets the visibility of the feature sets matching the specified query parameters. Invoking this method will update the visibility state of all of the feature sets' features to match the specified visibility state for the feature set.
        Parameters:
        params - The feature set query parameters
        visible - true to set the feature set and all of its features visible, false to set the feature set and all of its features invisible.
        Throws:
        java.lang.UnsupportedOperationException - if getVisibilitySettingsFlags() does not have the VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURESET bit toggled.
        See Also:
        VISIBILITY_SETTINGS_FEATURESET, getVisibilitySettingsFlags()

      • isFeatureSetVisible

        boolean isFeatureSetVisible​(long setId)
        Deprecated.
        Returns true if the feature set is visible. The feature set is considered visible if one or more of its child features are visible.
        Parameters:
        setId - The feature set ID
        Returns:
        true if the feature set is visible, false otherwise
        See Also:
        isFeatureVisible(long)

      • isAvailable

        boolean isAvailable()
        Deprecated.
        Returns a flag indicating whether or not the data store is currently available. In the event that the data store resides on a remote server, this method may return false when no connection with that server can be established.

        This method should always return false after the Disposable.dispose() method has been invoked.

        Returns:
        true if the data store is available, false otherwise.

      • refresh

        void refresh()
        Deprecated.
        Refreshes the data store. Any invalid entries are dropped.

      • getUri

        java.lang.String getUri()
        Deprecated.
